page.title: 12History of Pontispool Farm
page.content: Pontispool farm is 400 years old and is leased to a Mr. Whittle who has been on the farm for 40 years. The actual owner is a Major Mitford-Slade who lives in Monty's Court nearby. Up the road from the farm you pass an old school, built in the mid- nineteenth century by Mrs Slade, an ancestor of the Major. As she lived in Wey House a couple of kilometres away, she had a path built to the school which passes through the farm. Remnants of this walk, including a footbridge still exist on the farm. The school was built with money from the Great Western Railway who built over a cottage nearby. According to Mr. Whittle the G.W.R. line was closed in 1955. Many of the buildings on the farm incorporate ex-sleepers in their structure. An old well on the farm is said to be 500 years old.
